summary: This document is an email chain forwarding a response from Warden Lamine N'Diaye to Judge Richard M. Berman regarding an inquiry about Jeffrey Epstein (case 19 cr 490). It appears to be official correspondence between court staff and the correctional center following Epstein's arrest.

persons.name: Lamine N'Diaye
persons.context: Warden of the correctional center who provided a response to Judge Berman's inquiry regarding Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Richard M. Berman
persons.context: Federal judge who made an inquiry about Jeffrey Epstein (case 19 cr 490) and received a response from Warden N'Diaye.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the criminal case (19 cr 490) and the inquiry from Judge Berman to the correctional center.

connections.description: Judge Berman made an inquiry to Warden N'Diaye regarding Jeffrey Epstein, and N'Diaye provided a response.
Judge Berman is overseeing the criminal case (19 cr 490) against Jeffrey Epstein.
As warden, N'Diaye is responsible for the correctional center where Epstein was likely held, prompting the judge's inquiry.

events.title: Judge's Inquiry Regarding Epstein
events.description: Judge Richard M. Berman made an inquiry about Jeffrey Epstein (case 19 cr 490) to the correctional center, and Warden Lamine N'Diaye provided a response.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated August 12, 2019, regarding Jeffrey Epstein (case 19 cr 490).
Judge Richard M. Berman made an inquiry to the correctional center, and Warden Lamine N'Diaye responded.
The correspondence indicates official communication between the court and the correctional facility about Epstein's status or conditions.
The document references an attached letter from Judge Berman and a response from Warden N'Diaye.
The email is sent from a Supervisory Staff Attorney at the correctional center in New York.
